[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Secure E-Store System (SES) defines authentication, account registration, and secure transaction requirements for online purchasing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SES enables user registration, authentication, secure payments, account management, and encrypted transactions.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SES integrates with authentication services, payment gateways, and secure transaction APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SES provides a structured UI for account management, browsing, and checkout.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SES runs on cloud-based infrastructure optimized for desktops and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SES uses React.js frontend, Node.js backend, and PostgreSQL for data storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SES ensures encrypted data exchange via TLS 1.3 and HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SES optimizes login and payment processing performance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SES manages authentication, account registration, order processing, and payment security.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SES supports multi-device access and compliance with security policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SES connects to authentication, payment, and encryption APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SES enables secure registration, authentication, checkout, and payment processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SES is designed for customers, administrators, and support agents managing transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SES requires stable internet access for authentication and secure transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SES relies on encryption, secure storage, and SSL compliance.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: SSL Encryption: Protects sensitive data in transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with authentication, payment, and encryption services.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide secure access to account management, transactions, and checkout.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to register accounts and log in securely (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall authenticate users before enabling purchases (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall use SSL encryption to protect logins and transactions (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a structured UI for browsing, purchasing, and order tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process authentication within 3 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain 99.99% uptime with minimal service interruptions.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store user credentials, transaction records, and logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support encrypted authentication and transaction security.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with PCI-DSS and SSL encryption standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure security, reliability, regulatory compliance, and proactive monitoring for threats.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Authentication, account registration, checkout security, and payment validation confirmed.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and security policies.
[SEC] 5. References: SSL encryption standards, PCI-DSS compliance, and e-commerce security best practices.
